column4: hey guys, looking for some virtualbox advice... basically have a smb client on the host that the client connects to... sometimes/sometimes not... ryty.... very good question, I should have thouhgt of that
I'll try now (if it doesn't work)
hmmm... you've installed and adjusted samba with system-config-samba?
adjusted smb??? I just edited the smb.conf as required
ah, right on. I use the "system-samba-config" package to edit smb.conf usually. it's just easier and quicker for me.
oh right... didn't even realise it existed
its a good way to see if what you've done in smb.conf is viable. For really basic networking (like on my network ;) it works for me every time.
I too do the VirtualBox-to-Ubuntu using SMB configuration
Keep in mind Windows uses Domain prefixes before their usernames, now with Win7. So your windows user name is actually 'DOMAIN\username' not just 'username'
